channel.title: Seperate Threads
channel.description:
Obviously everyone knows the dreaded process cycle, well I have a few questions.
Should my process method be called every 500ms, or 600ms, and why?
Should I be creating a separate cycle for player updating, npc updating, and combat? why or why not?

item.title: Seperate Threads
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Hmm, alright, I’m still unsure of the second question I had, but thanks guys

@david: I have integrated an event system on my server, but just a while ago, Graham released another Event system that is supposedly a lot better; I really don’t feel like converting all that code…

Read full topic

item.title: Seperate Threads
item.dc:creator: @Fuse Fuse
item.description:
@Fuse wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:386858”][quote author=Fuse link=topic=482627.msg3535086#msg3535086 date=1300505568]
But what if you’ve got a dual or quad core processor. This means 2 or 4 threads can run side by side simultaneously with no interruptions, right?

Seperate threads for combat and the process() method on a single core processor would obviously be bad, as the two threads would share, in effect, a single thread, taking twice as along (creating slight delays)?

On a dual core processor you could have 1 thread dedicated to process() and the second thread for packets being sent to and fro the players?

Of course, you’d have to program the server to work as a multi-threaded server?

That’s my theory, was I close?
[/quote]No. Not at all close.

But on topic, just be event driven.[/quote]
Seems logical though.

Read full topic

[quote=“Fuse, post:6, topic:386858”]But what if you’ve got a dual or quad core processor. This means 2 or 4 threads can run side by side simultaneously with no interruptions, right?

Seperate threads for combat and the process() method on a single core processor would obviously be bad, as the two threads would share, in effect, a single thread, taking twice as along (creating slight delays)?

On a dual core processor you could have 1 thread dedicated to process() and the second thread for packets being sent to and fro the players?

Of course, you’d have to program the server to work as a multi-threaded server?

That’s my theory, was I close?[/quote]No. Not at all close.

But on topic, just be event driven.

item.title: Seperate Threads
item.dc:creator: @Fuse Fuse
item.description:
@Fuse wrote:

But what if you’ve got a dual or quad core processor. This means 2 or 4 threads can run side by side simultaneously with no interruptions, right?

Seperate threads for combat and the process() method on a single core processor would obviously be bad, as the two threads would share, in effect, a single thread, taking twice as along (creating slight delays)?

On a dual core processor you could have 1 thread dedicated to process() and the second thread for packets being sent to and fro the players?

Of course, you’d have to program the server to work as a multi-threaded server?

That’s my theory, was I close?
